results.question: Which Apollo mission was the first one to land on the Moon?
results.details: Apollo 11 was crewed by three astronauts - Commander Neil Armstrong, Buzz Aldrin, and Michael Collins. Aldrin successfully landed its lunar module - named 'Eagle' - on July 20, 1969 at 20:17 UTC. Armstrong became the first human on the moon 6 hours and 39 minutes later, on July 21 02:56 UTC. Aldrin and Armstrong spent approximately 2 hours and 15 minutes collecting 47.5 pounds of lunar material for analysis back on Earth. Collins flew the command module - named 'Columbia' - in orbit before rendevousing with Aldrin and Amrstrong in the Eagle after its sucessful launch from the lunar surface.

results.question: What is the largest animal currently on Earth?
results.details: The blue whale is an aquatic mammal that  has been recorded at 98 feet (29.9 meters) long and 190 tons (173 metric tons, or tonnes). While other, larger animals *may* have existed in the past and gone extinct, no evidence of larger animals on Earth has been uncovered.

results.question: How many constituent particles (atoms, molecules, ions, etc.) are equivalent to one mole (mol)?
results.details: This number is called Avogadro's number, sometimes called Avogadro's constant, is named after the scientis Amedeo Avogadro. The number was chosen so that the mass of one mole of a compound, in grams, divided by Avogadro's number is equivalent to the average mass of one molecule of the same compound, measured in daltons, the standard unit of atomic mass. One dalton is equal to the mass of one nucleon (either a neutron or proton), and is approximately 1.66 x 10^-24 grams.

results.question: Which element has the chemical symbol 'Fe'?
results.details: Fe comes from the Latin word 'Ferrium'. Iron is the most common element on Earth, forming much of the inner and outer core, but it only the fourth most common element in the Earth's crust.

results.question: The humerus, paired radius, and ulna come together to form what joint?
results.details: The radius and ulna form the bones of the lower arm and the humerus is the main bone of the upper arm.
